name: A* Search
description: Optimal informed search that combines actual cost g(n) with heuristic estimate h(n). Guarantees optimality when heuristic is admissible.
when_to_use: Weighted graphs with a good admissible heuristic available
Route planning in maps and navigation
Any problem where you need optimal cost AND have domain knowledge for heuristic
when_not_to_use: No reasonable heuristic available (use UCS instead)
When speed matters more than optimality (use Greedy Best-First)

complexity.time: O(b^d) worst case, but dramatically better with good heuristic
complexity.space: O(b^d) â€” stores all generated nodes

parameters.name: goal_test
parameters.description: Returns true if state is the goal

parameters.name: heuristic
parameters.description: Admissible heuristic: estimated cost to goal

embedding_text: A* search combines actual path cost g(n) with heuristic estimate h(n) for optimal informed search. Guarantees optimality with admissible heuristic. Best for pathfinding, navigation, puzzles. Evaluates f(n) = g(n) + h(n).
